intro: Gymnalypha, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a soft, velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. Gymnalypha is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
